content:
ObjectListFieldCollection Class

Definition

Represents a collection of ObjectListField objects. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
public class ObjectListFieldCollection : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ArrayListCollectionBase, System.Collections.ICollection, System.Web.UI.IStateManager, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection
Inheritance
Object
System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ArrayListCollectionBase
ObjectListFieldCollection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object,Object)

Items

Remarks

This class object provides the container for the fields of an ObjectList. Accessing the Fields property of an ObjectList retrieves an ObjectListFieldCollection object.

The properties and methods of the ObjectListFieldCollection class are a superset of the IObjectListFieldCollection interface. All properties and methods of that interface, including those that it inherits from the ASP.NET ICollection interface, are applicable here. This class provides additional properties and methods to modify the collection. These properties and methods provide standard collection management capability, such as adding, removing, and clearing the collection.

If you change the collection by calling the methods Add, AddAt, Remove, or RemoveAt during Page_Init, the view state for the Fields, Items, and ViewMode properties of the object list is ignored.

Properties

IsTrackingViewState

Indicates whether the collection tracking its view state changes. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected bool IsTrackingViewState { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if tracking its view state changes; otherwise, false.

Item(Int32)

The default indexer for the ObjectListFieldCollection class, allows the lookup of arbitrary capability values by index. Any of the properties can be accessed by name. However, the returned value will always be a string (or null if not defined), rather than a type-safe value. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField this[int index] { get; }
index
Int32

The index of the item to retrieve.

Value
ObjectListField

A string representing the value of the field at the specified index.

Methods

Add(ObjectListField)

Adds a field to the end of the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void Add (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField field);
field
ObjectListField

The ObjectListField to add to the end of the collection.

Remarks

This method is not available in the read-only IObjectListFieldCollection interface. Adding a field to the field collection of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control and requires you to bind data to the control again.

AddAt(Int32,ObjectListField)

Adds a field at the location in the collection specified by the index parameter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void AddAt (int index, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField field);
index
Int32

The location in the collection at which to add the field.

field
ObjectListField

The field to add at the specified location in the collection.

Remarks

A value of -1 for the index parameter specifies that the field is added to the end of the collection.

Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.

Clear()

Clears the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void Clear ();

Remarks

This method is not available in the read-only IObjectListFieldCollection interface.

You can use the Clear method for all the classes where this method applies. For example, the Clear method for a StyleSheet collection clears all the styles in the collection; or for the DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection, it clears all the choices in the collection.

Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.

GetAll()

Returns the items in the specified collection as a single array of ObjectListItem objects. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField[] GetAll ();
Returns
ObjectListField[]

The items in the specified collection as a single array of ObjectListItem objects.

IndexOf(String)

Returns the index of a field. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public int IndexOf (string fieldIDOrName);
fieldIDOrName
String

A string to compare with the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField.Title* or stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField.DataField* property.

Returns
Int32

The index of the specified field.

Remarks

In the second version of this method, it searches for a field with the Title property fieldId and returns the first matching field. If no match is found, it searches for a field with the DataField property's fieldID parameter and returns the first matching field. Otherwise, it returns -1.

IndexOf(ObjectListField)

Returns the index of a field. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public int IndexOf (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField field);
field
ObjectListField

A field to search for in the specified collection.

Returns
Int32

The index of the specified field.

Remarks

In the first version of this method, it returns the index of the specified field. If the specified field is not in the collection, it returns -1.

LoadViewState(Object)

Loads the previously saved view state to the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected void LoadViewState (object savedState);
savedState
Object

The object containing the view-state information to be loaded.

Remove(ObjectListField)

Removes the specified field. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void Remove (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField field);
field
ObjectListField

The field to remove.

Remarks

Not available in the IObjectListFieldCollection interface.

Removing a field from the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.

RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the item at the specified index. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void RemoveAt (int index);
index
Int32

The index number of the item to remove.

SaveViewState()

Saves the changes to a server control's view state to a Object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected object SaveViewState ();
Returns
Object

A Object that contains the view-state information.

SetAll(ObjectListField[])

Sets the array of ObjectListItem objects as the ObjectListFieldCollection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void SetAll (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField[] value);
value
ObjectListField[]

The ObjectListItem array.

TrackViewState()

Instructs the collection to track changes to its view state. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected void TrackViewState ();

Remarks

After this method has been called, the IsTrackingViewState property will return true. Also, the IsTrackingViewState property of the IStateManager objects in the MobileListItemCollection will be set to true.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState

For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

bool System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState { get; }
Returns
Boolean

To be added.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ObjectListFieldCollection instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.

IStateManager.LoadViewState(Object)

For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IStateManager.LoadViewState*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

void IStateManager.LoadViewState (object state);
state
Object

The object containing the view state to load.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ObjectListFieldCollection instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.

IStateManager.SaveViewState()

For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

object IStateManager.SaveViewState ();
Returns
Object

Returns either an object containing the ViewState changes or null.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ObjectListFieldCollection instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.

IStateManager.TrackViewState()

For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

void IStateManager.TrackViewState ();

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ObjectListFieldCollection instance is cast to an IStateManager interface.
